column4: hi all, I have tried google chrome on Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and still can not get Youtube video to play, it says "missing plugin"
can anyone help?
I thought someone mentioned last time to go for Chrome, not chromium as chromium does not have the right plugins for this
oh, ok I will give it a try then, both chrome and firefox both do not work for me
I tried for weeks to get it working. Then someone told me that the latest Flash included in Chrome doesn’t support my CPU (or vice versa).
For which browser theadmin ?
ahh I might have the same problem my CPU is very old
Mine is an AMD Athlon XP 2000 and doesn’t know some SSEEESSEEESEESEEEEEE… stuff
lol same processor as mine but I think mine is the 2300
Ok, then it really might be the same problem.
so would sudo apt-get install adobe-flashplugin still work for me?
sorry will do I am not at that system at the moment adknight87
This installs the last Flash version from Adobe that supports linux. Some Flash websites might not work.
(Adobe dropped linux after Flash 10.2)
oh!
so what did you do to get youtube working?
as sounds like I might have the same problem as you
I use HTML5.
never used that
youtube.com/html5
